intro: Maytenus tarapotensis, commonly known as the Tarapotense Mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Maytenus tarapotensis is often found in humid, tropical forests and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
